caption:
This photograph features a close-up of a flower, possibly a rose, predominantly illuminated from one side, creating a dramatic and moody effect. The lighting highlights the velvety texture of the petals, which are tinted with shades of dark red and white, suggesting a delicate interplay of light and shadow. The backdrop is almost entirely dark, emphasizing the solitary beauty of the flower which stands out as the central subject of the image.

The petals appear slightly wet, adding a fresh and dewy look, and some specks of light reflections are visible on the petals, giving the image a touch of sparkle. The overall composition focuses on the simplicity and elegance of nature, captured intimately and artistically. The vivid contrast between the dark background and the illuminated flower creates a striking visual emphasis on the flower's intricate details and the soft, subtle gradations of its colors.
title: Close-up of Douglas fir seeds in a cone. Timberland on Vancouver Island, British Columbia. Near Port Alberni, British Columbia, Canada. From the Environmental Protection Agency's Project DOCUMERICA collection, "In Praise of Forests". For additional images see Fiche #s 209, 210, 211, 212, and 213. ENTHEOS. September, 1974.
